Just paraphrasing myself from gitter to make sure my comments are not lost/forgotten:

> Felix, there's a race condition (I think) in the chain manager. As I'm not familiar with that part of the code I don't want to touch it, but could you or someone else familiar take a look?
> The issue is this function: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/develop/core/chain_manager.go#L524
> Here we first create a blocks array large enough to hold the future blocks
> Then iterate over the future blocks and insert
> If a block arrived in between, bam
> panic
> An easy enough solution would be to check i against len(blocks)
> but I don't want to just sweep the issue under the rug as there may be other occurances if this future thingy was used badly here
